```{r setup, include = FALSE}
options(htmltools.dir.version = FALSE)
library(knitr)
library(tidyverse)
library(xaringanExtra)
library(nhsrtheme)
library(NHSRdatasets)
# set default options
opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE,
               collapse = TRUE,
               fig.width = 7.252,
               fig.height = 4,
               dpi = 300,
               dev.args = list(type = "cairo"))

xaringanExtra::use_panelset()
xaringanExtra::use_clipboard()
xaringanExtra::use_webcam()
xaringanExtra::use_broadcast()
xaringanExtra::use_share_again()
xaringanExtra::style_share_again(
  share_buttons = c("twitter", "linkedin", "pocket")
)
```

# How to make our first slide?

- intro to xaringan structure
  - first slide: starts immediately after YAML
  - Markdown formatting: headings (#, ##, ###), **bold**, and _italics_, links with []()
  - new slide: `---`
  - incremental slides: `--`
  - presenter notes: `???` underneath body of slide and before the next slide (or `---`)
  
---
# Your turn: Make a hello slide

- slide will include a reminder of the options we just convered
- learners will be encouraged to mix and match
- name
- role
- institute/NHS organisation
- department
- links?

---
# What about moving stuff around?

- intro to layouts and classes
- content can be aligned vertically: top, middle, bottom
- content can be aligned horizontally: left, center, right
- you can align some of the content using `.left[]` for example
- or you can align all of the slide content using `class: left`
- you can also use layout classes: .pull-left, .pull-right, .left-column, .right-column
